meanings.definition: The act or process of fitting windows with glass.
meanings.sent1: The glazing of the windows made the house look brighter.
meanings.sent2: The glazing on the windows protected the house from the cold.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if the glazing of the windows will make the house look like a giant mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like the glazing on a freshly cleaned window.
meanings.sent5: The glazing on the windows reflected the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.definition: A thin, smooth, shiny coating or finish applied to a surface.
meanings.sent1: The cake was decorated with a sweet glazing on top.
meanings.sent2: The glazing on the pottery gave it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: The glazing on the donut made it look too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the glazing on a brand new car.
meanings.sent5: The glazing on the painting made the colors pop.

meanings.definition: The process of applying a transparent layer of paint to a surface.
meanings.sent1: The artist used glazing to create depth in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The glazing technique enhanced the colors of the artwork.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled glazing on my canvas, now it's all shiny!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like glazing, adding a transparent layer of joy to the room.
meanings.sent5: The glazing on the mural made it look like it was glowing.
